page.title: 04A FLETCHING OCTAGENARIAN
page.content: Mr Ernest Moore (Ernie) was born five minutes after midnight on July 13th 1902 in his parents house at Fletching . He started school when he was four. Then there were 189 pupils now there are only 49. School started at 8.55 but he went early to clean the lavatories, mix the ink and bring in the coal. He joined the church choir at five leaving when his voice broke. Since then he has played the organ in church for 53 years. In 1916 he left school (at 12 y 6 m) and took a job as a grocers apprentice at the grocers shop (now general store and Post Office) in the High Street. It was a difficult job with rationing in the First World War.He earned 15 shillings a week which would now be 75p. {C Rutter and R Bishop
